derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from Lynch's law, named after Capt. William Lynch, head of a self-constituted judicial tribunal in Virginia c.1780

entry.def: If an angry crowd of people lynch someone, they kill that person by hanging them, without letting them have a trial, because they believe that that person has committed a crime.

example.ex: They were about to lynch him when reinforcements from the army burst into the room and rescued him.
example.tran: 他们正准备动私刑绞死他时，援军闯入房间把他救下了。

sentences.sentence: "The blood-thirsty mob lynched the alleged killer of the child"
